result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Appeal of Eligibility Determination for Appoint of Counsel
Status conference on December 5, 2022 at 11:45 am.

1:50 PM Hearing held via Zoom due to Judge illness- parties agree to proceed. Defendant Chattman J Jordan in court.  Attorney Cecilia E DeMarco in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant filed Waiver of Right to Attorney. Defendant states he did not have enough time to submit paystub for CDP application but could do it this week. CT: DE to complete CDP process. File review set for 10/28 to check status of appointment. Trial dates taken off calendar. 

Status conference scheduled for December 5, 2022 at 11:45 am.

Defendant here today at Collections window to apply for county appointed attorney - to return with completed Petition for Counsel, bring along SPD Financial Eligibility Worksheet and provide most recent paystub.
DE's copy of 10/17/2022 STC Notice returned; unable to forward
Status conference on October 17, 2022 at 02:15 pm.

02:27 PM Defendant Chattman J Jordan in court. Prosecuting Atty Robin W Lee appeared for State of Wisconsin. 21CM1125 set for trial, this will follow  Status conference scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 02:15 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 11, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
01:49 PM Defendant Chattman J Jordan in court with attorney Michael J. Short. Prosecuting Atty Cecilia E DeMarco appeared for State of Wisconsin. set for plea/s
Status conference on May 4, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release. 
Trial Judge - Br 13

05:06 PM Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Guy Cardamone.  Lillian Rose Nelson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties by Zoom. The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.  Status conference scheduled for May 4, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
